content:
• Tuesday, November 29, 2011
  • WWR

    Shares of Uranium Resources (URRE) soared over 21% today, in anticipation of the company's...

    Shares of Uranium Resources (URRE) soared over 21% today, in anticipation of the company's announcement - released after today's close - that it intends to begin Phase II drilling at its Los Finados Project.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:45 PM | 1 Comment
  • CULP

    Culp (CFI) FQ2 beats estimates on a 19% Y/Y jump in revenue. Net sales were solid across all...

    Culp (CFI) FQ2 beats estimates on a 19% Y/Y jump in revenue. Net sales were solid across all business lines, with double-digit gains coming from its mattress and upholstery fabric units. Shares +5.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:22 PM
  • OVTI

    OmniVision Technologies (NASDAQ:OVTI) drops 9.7% AH after delivering its FQ2 report. While FQ2...

    OmniVision Technologies (NASDAQ:OVTI) drops 9.7% AH after delivering its FQ2 report. While FQ2 results beat Street estimates that were lowered following OmniVision's Nov. 7 warning - revenue of $217.9M (-9% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.48 vs. consensus of $214.6M and $0.32 - the company is guiding for FQ3 revenue of $160M-$180M and EPS of $0.05-$0.17, well below a consensus of $201.4M and $0.26. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • ANGI

    Another one bites the dust: Following today's sell-off, Angie's List (ANGI -9.2%) joins Groupon...

    Another one bites the dust: Following today's sell-off, Angie's List (ANGI -9.2%) joins Groupon (GRPN +5.1%) in trading below its IPO price, after posting a big first-day gain. Groupon recouped some of Monday's losses today, but LinkedIn (LNKD -1.6%) saw additional post-lockup selling pressure. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • RLD

    3D glasses maker RealD (RLD -9.2%) has finished a two-day roller coaster ride by giving back...

    3D glasses maker RealD (RLD -9.2%) has finished a two-day roller coaster ride by giving back nearly all of Monday's huge gains. Yesterday's rally may have been aided by optimism about Martin Scorsese's 3D film Hugo, which arrived in theaters last week. RealD shares are down 64% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • HSP

    Hospira (HSP -9.1%) shares plunge after RBC Capital says the generic injectable drug maker may...

    Hospira (HSP -9.1%) shares plunge after RBC Capital says the generic injectable drug maker may face “widespread” production breakdowns that could take two to three years to correct. Hospira has been working to correct flaws that led to recalls of two drugs in 2009 and 2010, but RBC believes the company’s manufacturing issues are "far greater than investors realize."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • HD

    Home Depot (HD +5.3) is leading all Dow stocks, perhaps enjoying a boost from an analyst...

    Home Depot (HD +5.3) is leading all Dow stocks, perhaps enjoying a boost from an analyst breakfast it held this morning. Janney says it has a strong growth plan in place: "HD is shifting its model to cater to DIY customers by changing mix in the store and focusing on smaller projects. Clearly, the company’s goal to achieve 10% operating margin is based on this scenario."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • SFL

    Ship Finance (SFL -10.8%) tumbles after Moody's slashes its debt rating to Ba3 from B1, sending...

    Ship Finance (SFL -10.8%) tumbles after Moody's slashes its debt rating to Ba3 from B1, sending it further into junk territory. The ratings agency is worried about Ship Finance's exposure to Frontline (FRO -7.2%), which recently crashed on liquidity fears. Also moving lower: TNK -5.3%. OSG -4.8%. PRGN -3.9%. DRYS -6.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 2 Comments
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE +8.6%) rallies after company officials state they've cut 350 jobs at two...

    A123 Systems (AONE +8.6%) rallies after company officials state they've cut 350 jobs at two Michigan electric car battery plants, on account of recent order cuts from top customer Fisker Automotive. A123, whose shares are down 76% YTD, says it expects Fisker's orders to rebound in Q2 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +4.1%) gets a lift from positive comments out of Credit Suisse today....

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +4.1%) gets a lift from positive comments out of Credit Suisse today. The company says its raising its price target to $11 from $9, due to an increase in Bakken inventory following the driller's recent acquisitions in North Dakota, plus expectations for an accelerated pace of development.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • MTOR

    Meritor (MTOR +4.3%) gains on a valuation upgrade to Overweight from Underweight at Morgan...

    Meritor (MTOR +4.3%) gains on a valuation upgrade to Overweight from Underweight at Morgan Stanley. The shares appear to have stabilized after hitting fresh 52-week lows during last week's selloff.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM
  • WBMD

    WebMD (WBMD +7.5%) spikes higher after The Street reports the company is "exploring a sales...

    WebMD (WBMD +7.5%) spikes higher after The Street reports the company is "exploring a sales process," and is already talking with PE firms. Carl Icahn and George Soros have both acquired large stakes in the health information services provider. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • PNC

    PNC Financial (PNC +1.1%) and Royal Bank of Canada (RY +1.7%) move higher after PNC files an 8-K...

    PNC Financial (PNC +1.1%) and Royal Bank of Canada (RY +1.7%) move higher after PNC files an 8-K stating the Fed won't require it to issue stock in order to go through with its $3.6B acquisition of RBC's U.S. retail bank business. PNC expects the deal to close in Q1 2012.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM
  • AZN

    AstraZeneca (AZN +1.3%) and Bristol-Myers (BMY +1.2%) trade higher after the European Commission...

    AstraZeneca (AZN +1.3%) and Bristol-Myers (BMY +1.2%) trade higher after the European Commission grants marketing authorization for komboglyze, a fixed dose combination drug for the treatment of type two diabetes. The approval covers all 27 member states of the European Union.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA +3.7%) shares bounce back after yesterday's slide on rumors of an impending report...

    Sina (SINA +3.7%) shares bounce back after yesterday's slide on rumors of an impending report from Muddy Waters, but at least Bill Bishop believes its books are clean: "There is a lot of value in both Sina’s core business and in Sina Weibo... at some point Sina shares could be a terrific bargain, assuming management can rebuild confidence with investors." A big if.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • RIG

    Transocean (RIG -8.4%) is selling off hard after announcing a 26M share offering, but Citi is...

    Transocean (RIG -8.4%) is selling off hard after announcing a 26M share offering, but Citi is remaining bullish. While calling the offering, which it thinks was done to maintain Transocean's investment-grade credit rating, a "major disappointment," Citi believes "rapidly improving conditions" in offshore rig markets will act as a tailwind for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • SPB

    Battery manufacturer Spectrum Brands (SPB +1.3%) trades up after Credit Suisse initiates...

    Battery manufacturer Spectrum Brands (SPB +1.3%) trades up after Credit Suisse initiates coverage with an Outperform rating. The firm says Spectrum's products offer the same performance as premium brands but for a lower price, which will drive sustainable revenue growth in FY11/12.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • NFLX

    Canaccord's Jeff Rath follows up on S&P's downgrade of Netflix (NFLX -3.3%) by reiterating a...

    Canaccord's Jeff Rath follows up on S&P's downgrade of Netflix (NFLX -3.3%) by reiterating a Sell on the company, arguing the company's massive capital needs will continue weighing on shares. Rath thinks losses for Netflix's international operations could exceed $100M in Q1 alone, and content purchase costs will exceed the amortization expenses reported on Netflix's income statement.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:11 PM
  • AGN

    Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI +2%) gains on FDA approval of its generic version of Bayer's...

    Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI +2%) gains on FDA approval of its generic version of Bayer's (OTCPK:BAYRY +0.7%) Yaz birth-control pill, adding to the company's growing number of products for women's health.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • GLW

    Davenport’s Drake Johnstone, with egg on his face after raising his rating on Corning (GLW...

    Davenport’s Drake Johnstone, with egg on his face after raising his rating on Corning (GLW -13%) shares a day before the company’s warning of lower-than-expected glass sales, scrambles to its defense, reiterating his Buy call and asserting that "panel maker demand for Corning’s glass substrates should improve in the first half of 2012." (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • HUM

    Humana (HUM +1.7%) trades higher after announcing it's acquired privately held SeniorBridge, a...

    Humana (HUM +1.7%) trades higher after announcing it's acquired privately held SeniorBridge, a New York-based chronic-care provider best known for providing in-home care for seniors. Terms of the deal weren't disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC -3.2%) takes out a 52 week low and closes in on a $4 handle (now at $5.07)....

    Bank of America (BAC -3.2%) takes out a 52 week low and closes in on a $4 handle (now at $5.07). At the epochal March 6, 2009 bottom, the stock was about $3 - one week later it had skied to $5.76 on its way to $18 over the next 5 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 6 Comments
  • TDS

    Telephone & Data Systems (TDS +7%) pops after saying its board of directors has approved a...

    Telephone & Data Systems (TDS +7%) pops after saying its board of directors has approved a revised plan to reclassify each of its special common shares as 1.087 common shares. Previously each special common share was to be reclassified at a one-to-one ratio, but the proposal failed to receive enough votes due to the high premium attached to the special common share price. Separately, Gabelli reiterates a buy on the news.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:57 PM
  • DNR

    Denbury Resources (DNR +4.2%) draws an upgrade to Buy from Neutral at Robinson Humphrey, where...

    Denbury Resources (DNR +4.2%) draws an upgrade to Buy from Neutral at Robinson Humphrey, where analysts estimate the value of DNR’s assets at $25.50/share. "As new fields come online and the share count is reduced, we expect this value to continue moving higher," the company says, setting a price target of $20 for the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM
  • CEO

    Nexen (NXY +5.7%) rises after announcing it will sell for $700M a 40% stake in its Horn River,...

    Nexen (NXY +5.7%) rises after announcing it will sell for $700M a 40% stake in its Horn River, Cordova and Liard basins in northeast British Columbia to a consortium led by Japan’s Ipex Corp. The companies also say they will jointly investigate the feasibility of a potential downstream project, including liquid natural gas exports.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • MTRN

    Electronics component manufacturer Materion (MTRN +3.7%) gets a lift from a KeyBanc upgrade to...

    Electronics component manufacturer Materion (MTRN +3.7%) gets a lift from a KeyBanc upgrade to Buy on valuation. The firm cites better-than-expected Black Friday sales, pent-up consumer demand and cautious electronic production schedules into the holiday season that could lead to modest demand recovery early next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM
  • IDIX

    Shares of Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +5.5%) ride the coattails of Inhibitex's positive...

    Shares of Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +5.5%) ride the coattails of Inhibitex's positive Hepatitis C trial data higher. Analysts at Baird also chipped in with a reiterated Market Perform rating on the biopharmaceutical company.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • DRJ

    Sports products and licensed memorabilia retailer Dreams (DRJ +1.5%) reports a 40% Y/Y increase...

    Sports products and licensed memorabilia retailer Dreams (DRJ +1.5%) reports a 40% Y/Y increase in sales during Cyber Monday. The company says it received more than 61,000 orders for its online licensed sports products with an order value of $3.5M, versus $2.5M earned last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • SLB

    Schlumberger (SLB +2.8%) trades higher after being initiated with a Buy at Jefferies. The firm...

    Schlumberger (SLB +2.8%) trades higher after being initiated with a Buy at Jefferies. The firm says Schlumberger is "the undisputed industry leader, with a global footprint and leading technology across most product lines," and is well positioned to capitalize on a recovery in deepwater drilling activity.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 2 Comments
  • CRBC

    Citizens Republic (CRBC +4%) gains after being upgraded to Outperform on valuation at Boenning...

    Citizens Republic (CRBC +4%) gains after being upgraded to Outperform on valuation at Boenning & Scattergood. The firm cites a stronger earnings and capital outlook.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • VRA

    Shares of Vera Bradley (VRA -5.5%) look like another casualty from Tiffany's warning on luxury...

    Shares of Vera Bradley (VRA -5.5%) look like another casualty from Tiffany's warning on luxury sales in Europe. Not even JPMorgan reaffirming an Overweight rating could counterbalance increasing fear global sales will weaken.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM
  • STX

    Seagate's (STX +3.8%) guidance hike, which includes optimistic shipment forecasts for the March...

    Seagate's (STX +3.8%) guidance hike, which includes optimistic shipment forecasts for the March quarter, is providing a lift to archrival Western Digital (WDC +4.4%), as well as flash memory vendors OCZ Technology (OCZ +5.7%) and Fusion-io (FIO +5.4%). Intel (INTC +1.4%), Nvidia (NVDA +1.1%), and AMD (AMD +2.1%) might also be getting a boost, given Seagate's importance to the PC industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • PES

    Jefferies downgrades a few North American land drillers today, citing lower land rig and...

    Jefferies downgrades a few North American land drillers today, citing lower land rig and pressure pumping expectations and a higher risk/reward profile compared to their offshore peers: Nabors (NBR +0.7%), Patterson UTI (PTEN +0.8%), Pioneer Drilling (PDC -5.1%) and Union Drilling (UDRL -3.6%) are all cut to Hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • MKSI

    MKS Instruments (MKSI +2.5%) trades higher after DA Davidson starts coverage on the company with...

    MKS Instruments (MKSI +2.5%) trades higher after DA Davidson starts coverage on the company with a Buy and $35 PT. The firm sees MKS gaining share in a weak chip equipment market on account of relatively healthy spending for leading-edge manufacturing processes, and also claims its valuation is at a significant discount to industry peers.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • CCRN

    Cross Country Healthcare (CCRN -7.5%) dips after SunTrust cut the shares to Neutral earlier...

    Cross Country Healthcare (CCRN -7.5%) dips after SunTrust cut the shares to Neutral earlier today, citing a deteriorating growth outlook for temporary nurses and pricing competition for MSP contracts.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • TIF

    Tiffany (TIF -9.1%) exec Mark Aaron says in an earnings CC that despite global economic...

    Tiffany (TIF -9.1%) exec Mark Aaron says in an earnings CC that despite global economic uncertainties, the luxury retailer saw strong growth at its highest price points and in geographic regions easy accessible to Asian tourists. In a mild surprise, Aaron outlines that sales in the U.K. declined while increased brand awareness kept double-digit gains in place for the firm in debt-laden Italy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • GLW

    Corning's (GLW -10.9%) Q4 warning, which it partly attributes to lower demand for its...

    Corning's (GLW -10.9%) Q4 warning, which it partly attributes to lower demand for its high-margin Gorilla Glass from the tablet market, may reveal it to be the latest casualty of the iPad's (NASDAQ:AAPL) high-end tablet dominance. Corning's list of Gorilla Glass tablets includes models from Samsung, Motorola, Acer, and others. NVDA and ATML are two other key suppliers for high-end iPad challengers.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 7 Comments
  • AAL

    Other legacy carriers are trading higher on the back of AMR's (AMR -81.9%) Chapter 11 filing:...

    Other legacy carriers are trading higher on the back of AMR's (AMR -81.9%) Chapter 11 filing: LCC +7%, UAL +6.4%, DAL +3.2%. Aversion to AMR may benefit these names as consumers look to avoid potential problems as a result of the restructuring. But on the flip side, the restructuring could enable it to become a stronger competitor.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • FMCN

    Muddy Waters reiterates its strong sell rating on Focus Media (FMCN -5.1%), seeing the company's...

    Muddy Waters reiterates its strong sell rating on Focus Media (FMCN -5.1%), seeing the company's response to initial fraud allegations as only reinforcing that view. Among other things, MW cautions the "independent" verification of the number of LCD screens is likely to be compromised, as is often the case in China (and other places). Carson Block is scheduled on CNBC at 2 ET. (the saga)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Following a short-lived runup yesterday, Netflix (NFLX -5.1%) does an about-face and continues...

    Following a short-lived runup yesterday, Netflix (NFLX -5.1%) does an about-face and continues its descent after S&P cuts its already junk-grade credit rating by another notch to BB- late Monday. The ratings agency says the company's aggressive expansion plans are likely to hurt its profitability as its subscriber growth decelerates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • THO

    Thor Industries (THO -3.4%) shares slide a day after reporting FQ1 earnings of $0.41/share, a...

    Thor Industries (THO -3.4%) shares slide a day after reporting FQ1 earnings of $0.41/share, a tad below consensus estimates and lower than $0.44 in the year-ago period. The RV maker's net sales grew to $673M vs. $606.7M, but costs rose faster than sales. The company says it's pleased with recent RV orders but cautions that promotional pricing remains.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • NVLN

    Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR) gains 4.5% after Deutsche Bank initiates coverage with a Buy...

    Aegerion Pharmaceuticals (AEGR) gains 4.5% after Deutsche Bank initiates coverage with a Buy rating and $19 price target. An analyst with the firm says the biotech firm is undervalued with the full potential of its drug pipeline and upcoming FDA approvals not yet factored into its share price.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM
  • CTB

    Cooper Tire & Rubber (CTB -1.6%) trades lower after announcing an immediate lockout of its...

    Cooper Tire & Rubber (CTB -1.6%) trades lower after announcing an immediate lockout of its Findlay, Ohio, plant as the tire maker seeks to reach a competitive wage and benefit contract with its union workers. The company began contract negotiations with the union nearly three months ago, but, up to this point, has been unable to reach any tangible agreement.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAL

    AMR shares open for trading after being halted following its Chapter 11 filing, now -85% to $0.24.

    AMR shares open for trading after being halted following its Chapter 11 filing, now -85% to $0.24.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • BECN

    Shares of Beacon Roofing (BECN -6.1%) fall off sharply despite knocking out a FQ4 earnings beat...

    Shares of Beacon Roofing (BECN -6.1%) fall off sharply despite knocking out a FQ4 earnings beat on revenue of $576M (+19% Y/Y). The movement wipes out a pre-earnings release rally from yesterday of comparable strength.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM
  • TIF

    Tiffany's (TIF -9.9%) Q4 outlook missed expectations due to sales weakness in Europe, and its...

    Tiffany's (TIF -9.9%) Q4 outlook missed expectations due to sales weakness in Europe, and its troubles are hitting shares of other retailers with increased exposure to Europe: COH -3.5%, RL -2.1%, Tommy Hilfiger and Calvin Klein parent PVH -0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 2 Comments
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +6%) shoots higher following an upgrade to Market Perform from...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +6%) shoots higher following an upgrade to Market Perform from Bernstein's Pierre Ferragu. Among his reasons: RIM has a large patent portfolio; activist shareholders could bring about major changes; and the company's valuation of just ~$120/user could spark buyout interest. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • DDS

    Dillard's (DDS -4.1%) gets rapped with a downgrade to Neutral from Buy from Sterne Agee....

    Dillard's (DDS -4.1%) gets rapped with a downgrade to Neutral from Buy from Sterne Agee. Analysts with the firm cite increasing margin pressure for the retailer as they cut earnings estimates for FY11 to FY12 and slash their price target on shares to $47 from $58.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • CAST

    Shares of ChinaCast Education (OTCPK:CAST) fall 5.5% in early trading after the company is the...

    Shares of ChinaCast Education (OTCPK:CAST) fall 5.5% in early trading after the company is the target of detailed fraud allegations from Kerrisdale Capital (.pdf).
     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • GLW

    Corning (NYSE:GLW) -9.1% after issuing downward guidance on Q4 LCD glass volume, now expected to...

    Corning (NYSE:GLW) -9.1% after issuing downward guidance on Q4 LCD glass volume, now expected to rise only slightly sequentially vs. previous guidance of 10%-plus growth. Also, LCD glass price declines are expected to be more significant in Q4. As a result, consolidated equity earnings are expected to decline 30% vs. original guidance of down 5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM

  • Market preview: EU shares begin to turn lower and S&P futures (+0.3%) pare earlier gains, as...

    Market preview: EU shares begin to turn lower and S&P futures (+0.3%) pare earlier gains, as investors realize that with record 7.89% yields, Italy's €7.5B bond auction wasn't so good after all. AMR is halted after filing for bankruptcy. Tiffany -7.7% after disappointing guidance, but Seagate +8.9% on its positive outlook. Later: consumer confidence, Fedspeak.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 1 Comment
  • INHX

    Inhibitex (NASDAQ:INHX) gains 6.5% in premarket trading after reporting positive data from...

    Inhibitex (NASDAQ:INHX) gains 6.5% in premarket trading after reporting positive data from clinical tests of its INX-189 hepatitis C treatment and saying it plans to expand its testing to evaluate the effect of various doses. The company notes it will use the proceeds from a 1.9M common stock offering to help support its INHX-189 development in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • STX

    Premarket gainers: STX +9%. CEDC +9%. INHX +7%. ONXX +4%. TS +4%. GOLD +4%. RIMM +3%. TCL-OLD...

    Premarket gainers: STX +9%. CEDC +9%. INHX +7%. ONXX +4%. TS +4%. GOLD +4%. RIMM +3%. TCL-OLD +3%.
    Losers: TIF -8%. RIG -6%. TLAB -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) +3.3% premarket as it unveils its Mobile Fusion enterprise mobility...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) +3.3% premarket as it unveils its Mobile Fusion enterprise mobility system, which aims to help corporate customers keep track of employees' BlackBerrys as well as devices running Android and iOS. The move incorporating competitors' products is a tacit acknowledgment by RIMM that its grip on the corporate smartphone market is loosening.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • ONXX

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) +4.1% premarket after announcing FDA acceptance of its new...

    Onyx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ONXX) +4.1% premarket after announcing FDA acceptance of its new drug application for carfilzomib, a next generation proteasome inhibitor for the potential treatment of patients with relapsed and refractory multiple myeloma.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:52 AM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO) is up 2.3% following the latest rumors (I, II) of bids from PE firms. Central to...

    Yahoo (YHOO) is up 2.3% following the latest rumors (I, II) of bids from PE firms. Central to Silver Lake's bid may be a plan to have Marc Andreessen - the co-founder of Netscape and freewheeling VC firm Andreessen Horowitz - play a key role. Andreessen has a lot of pull among Silicon Valley startups and engineers, but is already quite occupied, and is reportedly unsure of whether Yahoo can be turned around.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM
  • AAL

    AMR (AMR -60.5%) crashes and burns following its bankruptcy filing, while airline ETF FAA is...

    AMR (AMR -60.5%) crashes and burns following its bankruptcy filing, while airline ETF FAA is -4.1%. AMR also names 22-year company veteran Thomas Horton as CEO and Chairman to succeed Gerard Arpey, who plans to retire. Horton was named president of AMR and American Airlines in July 2010. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM | 1 Comment
  • TIF

    Tiffany (TIF -7%) dives premarket despite an earnings beat as Q4 EPS guidance of $1.48-$1.58 was...

    Tiffany (TIF -7%) dives premarket despite an earnings beat as Q4 EPS guidance of $1.48-$1.58 was a little light against expectations. In addition to obvious slowing in Europe, the company also noted weakness in the eastern part of the U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM
  • JBLU

    Shares of JetBlue (NASDAQ:JBLU) show the biggest reaction among U.S. carriers to American...

    Shares of JetBlue (NASDAQ:JBLU) show the biggest reaction among U.S. carriers to American Airlines' (NASDAQ:AMR) bankruptcy filing, losing 4.9% premarket. UAL, DAL, and LUV are all trading in slightly positive territory premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:25 AM | 1 Comment
